resources.string:
Pinball applications are more playable with real buttons!


This application allows to use an USB keyboard as pinball buttons.


The motivation of this software is the construction of a mini pinball cabinet, comprising a tablet, an USB keybord controller, arcade buttons, and a wooden enclosure. See
http://www.instructables.com/id/Mini-Pinball-1/ .


It listens to keyboard events, and generates touchscreen taps on the bottom screen corners. This way, any Android pinball application can be controlled.


Your tablet needs to have an USB host (aka on-the-go) port, to which the keyboard shall be connected. Only left and right buttons are supported. No plunger is yet supported.


For more information about setup, cabinet construction and source code, please visit: http://ten.homelinux.net/pb/pinball/.
